the process of using information that is already known to guess or think about what might happen: The assumption involves considerable extrapolation. The age of the lichens can be determined by extrapolation from their growth rate. See
extrapolate
More examplesFewer examplesBold prophecies have given way to timorous extrapolations.The analysis was based on historical knowledge and extrapolation from fragmentary scraps of information.Straight-line extrapolation from the past into the future is a poor guide for strategic planning.

the process of using existing information to discover what is likely to happen or be true in the future: extrapolation of sth The bank expects inflation to overshoot target in two years, but this is only an extrapolation of past trends.extrapolation from sth Extrapolation from the past into the future is a poor guide for strategic business planning.
